26.04.text:
Here we are then, you and I,
having left the cave

30.51.text:
and tamed the animals,
having sown the seed

34.46.text:
and grown
from village tribe to city state

38.32.text:
to a world of warring nations,
now we wait

42.32.text:
at the borders of our perception,
waiting for the vision

46.53.text:
to go beyond this nation
to be one human family on this Earth.

59.86.text:
We look to the eyes, to the eyes that see
us,

64.43.text:
to the face that looms each day.
The mother's face above the crib

71.14.text:
smiles and snarls, kisses and barks,
and sings the song of the world.

79.46.text:
Pushed and pulled as she is by the power outside of her
she clings to the clutch of her child

85.88.text:
and pours into the new-born being
her love for everything

94.21.text:
If we retrace our steps along the path that
brought us here we can uncover the original

100.50.text:
innocence that still exists within us. The
so-called sins have been laid on us like cloaks

109.56.text:
to cover our nakedness. As a child we were
subject to the moods and whims of those who

117.10.text:
protected and provided for us, who covered
us with cloaks and exposed us to their fears.

125.50.text:
This intelligence within each one of us is
a pure thing. Even now,

132.85.text:
no matter how troubled by life, within you
is a pure intelligence using your life.

140.86.text:
Honor this continuous energy pulsing within
you.

146.35.text:
The original innocence lives on, always available
at the untroubled center of your being, alive

153.22.text:
on myriad wavelengths brought together in
you. Honor this original innocence, the foundation

160.47.text:
of your life.
Bring it with you. See it in others.

208.88.text:
The intelligence of the whole being is always
available, and the original innocence with

214.94.text:
which we experienced our early years is still
accessible.

219.69.text:
However, our culture requires of us a vast
amount of memory and learned knowledge in

225.79.text:
order to participate in the way of life. And
participation is compulsory. Every child is

233.67.text:
made to attend school and to be obedient to
authority. Disobedience brings punishment

240.37.text:
and guilt, and the young mind is busied with
a learned fear. The "powers that be" dominate

247.97.text:
the child and the child learns to divide the
whole into right and wrong, good and bad.

255.41.text:
Therefore as we grow and adapt to the requirements
imposed on us, the intelligence of our being

261.68.text:
is concentrated in our minds by necessity,
and our original innocence is obscured

272.70.text:
Let's call this culture with its adversarial
rule of law and its absolute authority over

281.24.text:
the person, with all of its great inventions
and its printed money, let's call this way

291.95.text:
The Labyrinth includes all that we covet and
all that we disdain, a tragic-comic carnival

298.15.text:
of clowns and monsters, lovers and haters,
winners and losers.

305.14.text:
In the labyrinth the warrior belief system
is in power: with rewards and punishments,

310.89.text:
friends and enemies, persons of power and
wealth, and persons in jail waiting to be

317.62.text:
executed. The Labyrinth is a maze of opposites
where the challenge to fight the battle is

323.10.text:
thrust upon us in order to survive, and in
order to succeed.

330.34.text:
One learns to live with conflict in the labyrinth,
adapts to the punishments and strives for

336.95.text:
the rewards. A person can become skillful
in dealing with adversarial relationships

342.81.text:
like the warrior, the lawyer, the politician,
or one can be obedient and submit to the flow

350.00.text:
and try to make the best of it.
But many of us feel trapped in the labyrinth

355.92.text:
and are not well-suited for a life of conflict.
We don't want to go to war, or fight

361.29.text:
legal battles, or run for office; we're much
more interested in the pursuit of happiness,

368.72.text:
or in the enjoyment of nature, or in some
artistic endeavor. We would prefer a more

375.10.text:
harmonious way of life than the labyrinth
can provide.

379.93.text:
We'd like to find a way out from the labyrinth
but there appears to be none. No exit is permitted.

387.27.text:
The rule of law is universal and compulsory,
as are money, licenses and taxes. The legal

396.47.text:
and police forces insist on absolute power
over each person.

401.54.text:
How then can we contemplate a way out?
The way out is connected to the way in.

408.79.text:
The way you went in is the way out. By retracing
your steps and unraveling the knots you've

416.49.text:
tied within your mind, by releasing your self
from judgment and the confusion of hopes and

423.84.text:
fears that you were required to learn, you
can find your own way out from the labyrinth,

431.10.text:
because the labyrinth is the creation of your
mind and does not exist without thought.

441.06.text:
In order to participate in the labyrinth we
enter a trance, a dream state, in which we

447.42.text:
subordinate ourselves, our souls, to
a power over and outside of us. We suspend

454.27.text:
our disbelief and submit to the ruling voice.
Fooled by fear we wander into the labyrinth

462.87.text:
doing what's expected of us, just like everyone
else.

470.51.text: But we can awaken from this trance.

474.01.text:
The way out of the labyrinth is by a change
in consciousness.

478.78.text:
When the mind rests, and the chatterer is
quiet for a timeless time, the intelligence

485.46.text:
of the whole being becomes available. When
we place ourselves where there is no need

491.58.text:
for thought, perhaps on a secluded beach or
a mountain-top, then, when our thinking stops,

500.01.text: we can experience that change in our consciousness...

509.98.text:
a completely familiar place for each and every one of us. We become aware of a whole
intelligence within us that includes all of

518.31.text:
our processes.
This is the indivisible consciousness of the soul.

524.93.text:
The soul comes from a place before birth and
goes to a place beyond death, and uses the

533.26.text:
whole brain even as the thinking mind is ignorant
of it.

538.74.text:
As soon as we recognize that the living soul
within us is infinitely more aware than our

542.92.text:
worded sense, the learned values and remembered
knowledge can take a lesser place in the being.

550.41.text:
When we awaken to the consciousness of the
soul we realize that the labyrinth and the

555.13.text:
warrior belief system is a dream, a creation
of the mind, and can be exercised or not,

563.14.text:
at will.
This soul is our original innocence, a whole

568.98.text:
intelligence in touch with the essence of
life itself. The source of life is within

576.32.text:
us, evolving over millions of years to become
this, indivisible, beyond judgment, beyond

584.38.text: good and evil, beyond the labyrinth.

672.58.text:
The inner person is our priority, not the
outside authority, not the judge, not the

679.39.text:
commander-in-chief, nor the medical expert.
The treatment is from within.

686.67.text:
Even the madman murderer must be understood
by himself before change is possible.

692.85.text: Murdering the murderer continues the madness.

696.96.text:
The path of each person is valid. Each living
thing is on its own course moved by an inner

702.99.text:
intelligence. If we can honor this intelligence
within each person, our conflicts and self-destructive

708.53.text:
behavior will be diminished.
The only vehicle we have is the person,

716.73.text:
nothing less, nothing more. "The People" is an idea
in the mind of a person.

725.19.text:
If we are to devise a more harmonious way
of life it must benefit the person.

730.87.text:
We are all here together, a particular species,
evolving through birth and death on this spinning

735.86.text:
orb, which even now is zipping through the
heavens with all of us aboard.

740.54.text:
We are in fact sharing this Earth, and totally contained within it. What are we doing here? What's going on?
If we could watch a time-lapse film of the

752.85.text:
planet over the past century, we would see
huge cities erupting with an exploding humanity,

760.24.text:
great chains of mechanized energy and new-born
millions of people suddenly rushing around

765.68.text:
the world. We would see wars like cancers
on the body of humanity, a global skin disease

773.89.text:
of human self-destruction, exploding before
our eyes.

779.73.text:
What is this strange disease we suffer which
destroys our lives? What kind of confusion

786.04.text:
is it that sets person against person and
nation against nation, not just in argument

792.94.text:
but with atrocities to the death? Why can't
the children of Abraham share their resources

798.38.text:
and work together for their mutual benefit?
Why do we habitually choose to kill and maim

803.77.text:
each other? Is this the same confusion that
sets the cells of the human body against each

808.94.text:
other? We say of course that a healthy human
body does not have cancer. But do we say that

816.00.text:
a healthy human society does not have wars?
Not yet; we're still defending ourselves with a vengeance.

900.07.text:
Our belief system is based on the idea that
the mind can control the whole person.

906.92.text:
If I believe I am centered in my mind, then worded
language and the Rule of Law can perhaps control me.

913.05.text:
But the whole person includes an intelligence
beyond the comprehension of the mind.

919.99.text:
The mind, the worded sense, is inadequate to deal
with the complexities of the whole being.

926.95.text:
The facts of life in Western Culture include
the imposition of a false idea:

933.89.text:
that human intelligence is under the direction of the
human mind.

938.57.text:
This is so obviously absurd that one thought
is sufficient to refute it: the human mind

944.37.text:
does not understand, and nor can science explain,
our own uncharted brain which functions

950.43.text:
on wavelengths
beyond the reach of thought and remembered knowledge.

956.78.text:
As long as our belief system places the mind
and its book of laws at the center, then awareness

963.08.text:
of our soul is obscured. Only when the mind
gives up control or attempted control, is

969.96.text:
there a possibility of the soul-consciousness
emerging.

975.05.text:
The soul is the living intelligence of the
human being. Each of us is essentially an

981.45.text:
intelligent living soul. Our mind is developed
after our

985.90.text:
birth and created by the soul for the benefit
of human relationship. The soul is in touch

992.86.text:
with all aspects of the life being lived,
including what is explainable in language,

998.75.text:
and what is not. Including what is conscious and what is unconscious. 
If we truly understand that the soul uses

1008.50.text:
the mind, rather than the mind uses the soul,
then our belief system becomes a personal

1014.36.text:
spiritual process rather than a mental compulsion
of laws and punishments.

1021.22.text:
The conductor of the life being lived, the
user of this intelligence, the possessor of

1028.45.text:
this uncharted brain,
is a living soul.

1087.92.text:
Not far from here there is a cage,
with hundreds of unhappy people locked inside.

1096.78.text:
Outside the cage armed guards are watching.
A boy is trying to squeeze out through the

1103.50.text:
bars of the cage.
The boy's mother is embarrassed as people around

1108.21.text:
her snarl angrily.
She pulls him back and scolds him.

1111.73.text:
"If you go out there, bad things will happen," she says,
"you could die!"

1118.54.text:
Again and again he tries to escape. Again
and again she scolds him.

1125.04.text:
Then, one night when the moon is full
and everyone is sleeping,

1131.12.text:
the boy sucks in his breath.
He squeezes and squeezes,

1136.07.text:
and the bars seem to bend,
and suddenly, he's through... he's outside the cage.

1142.43.text: A guard lies snoring next to the gate, he's chained to the cage.

1148.67.text:
The boy notices the key to the cage is around
the guard's neck, but no one has noticed, he's free.

1153.83.text:
He runs into the woods.
When he's far away from the cage, he climbs a tree and rests.

1164.50.text: Over the next months the boy learns

1167.54.text:
how to take care of himself by helping others.
He helps a farmer during harvest,

1173.22.text:
and a shepherd with his sheep.
And he grows bigger and stronger.

1178.68.text:
And every day he thinks of his mother
and all the unhappy people trapped inside

1183.89.text:
the cage.
He resolves to set them free.

1189.14.text:
One day he sets off on a journey back to the
cage.

1192.77.text:
He arrives at night while the guards are sleeping.
Carefully he takes the key from around the

1199.16.text:
guard's neck,
and unlocks the gate of the cage.

1204.35.text:
He finds his mother and gently wakes her up. "Quick!" he says to his mother.
"Let's go! The gate is unlocked, and I have the key" She is horrified.

1219.11.text: "Come on," he says to the unhappy people, "you're all free!"

1221.60.text: No-one wants to leave the cage...

1226.39.text:
So, taking the key with him, and leaving the
gate unlocked,

1231.08.text:
he leaves the cage once more.
disappointed and sad to leave his mother behind

1235.66.text:
but now that he's found his freedom he will
never let it go.

1239.98.text:
A soft rain is falling as he runs through
the woods to the open fields beyond.

1275.33.text:
A few centuries ago we woke up to the fact
that the world was not flat, but a sphere;

1291.98.text:
and we realized the earth had always been
a sphere, even while we had thought it flat.

So now we are awakening to the realization
that humanity is one whole society, one global

1305.67.text:
economy, one family of beings in a shared
environment.

No matter how we divide ourselves,

1325.69.text:

This fundamental condition that we share,

1330.61.text:
the human soul, is unchangeable by religion

Our ancestors designed the systems and built
the institutions that we've inherited;

each generation modifying the social structure

When the American colonies threw out the British

idea that the ruling power, whether by king

1371.85.text:
every person, and may force its laws, wars, punishments,
wars, on all.

1378.20.text:
We're still subject to
that power in the form of a national government

Each person must submit to an adversarial

for power.
We have been taught to struggle as a way of

1403.83.text:

This condition pervades every aspect of the

over all.

Our predicament is we've inherited a social

1439.18.text:

1499.48.text:
man, nation against nation.
Many of us see the absurdity and the tragedy

is sponsored by national governments that
recognize no other authority than their own,

None of these governments serves humanity

There have been radical changes in the human

1539.47.text:
our governmental, political and legal systems

1545.40.text:
were designed and built many years ago by
warriors for warriors with ideals of dominance,

1551.45.text:
and conquest, and defeating the opposition.
Now our need is for a new generation of institutions

1557.93.text:
that function for the benefit of the individual
person and the whole human family, and

There is an ancient truth that humanity has

this civilization. We are directed from a

1582.09.text:
not in the legislatures, not in the seats

1595.77.text:
We are possessed by an unconscious intelligence

This intelligence is at work within each one

Our spiritual wholeness is being ignored in

If we continue to join the conflict, if we

Man against man is not the answer. Man against

Our quest for a more harmonious social order

1707.63.text:

Rather than working against each other, our

We can more easily work together for shared

1720.39.text:

1724.99.text:
The way we think is within our personal power.
The healing of human conflict is an inside

By concentrating on what is mutually beneficial

Our difficulty is that the requirements of

1814.68.text: This is the first step on an inner journey.

The purpose of the journey is not to correct

1829.31.text:
The inner dialogue reveals our confusion as

When we allow ourselves to be who we naturally

The realization is that the self is whole

1874.95.text:

We share a common condition as human beings

1932.30.text:

Our love, our work, our joyful task is to

1963.80.text:
The truths of our existence are beyond governance.
No amount of force, no amount of legislation

Nor will we achieve a more harmonious way

1976.35.text:

1982.99.text:
The truths of our existence are within us

2018.33.text:
There are three steps each of us can take

2022.35.text:

1. Recognize and admit that you can spend

2044.39.text:
2. Acknowledge the given talents that you

2052.62.text:

2059.22.text:
3. Now use those developed skills to work

2065.94.text:

great religions at the root of the conflict

Each of us, and each living thing, is in direct

This direct connection within us is sacred,

Can we accept this sacred quality in each
